result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan R Krubert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $500.00 fine plus costs ON EACH COUNT.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-----------------------------------

Maintain full time employment or full time schooling or a combination of the two.
-----------------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No prescription medication without a valid prescription and must be taken within limits of the prescription. No driving without a valid license. No contact with George Capriotti or Kurt Bullis.
-----------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
-----------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.   Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.
-------------------------------------

timeConds.notes: Complete fifty hours (50) of community service work during EACH year of probation ordered to total one-hundred fifty hour of community service work WITHOUT buyout option for a total of one-hundred fifty hours (150)  in and for the benefit of Walworth County.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan R Krubert

records.addlTxt: Order for Community Service

10:01 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Jonathan R Krubert in court with attorney Patrick Joseph Stangl.  
Matter is before the Court for a sentencing hearing.  Court makes record with regard to charges and maximum potential penalties.  Court understands that both sides are free to argue.  The Court did review the materials submitted by Atty Stangl.  
10:02 am  Attorney Herrmann makes record that parties do have an agreement for a withheld sentence and 3 years probation with no conditional jail time.  Atty Herrmann makes record with regard to conditions of probation that he is recommending.  
10:04 am  Response by Attorney Stangl.  
10:07 am  Response by Attorney Stangl to Court's questions.  Deft is currently working for his mother.  
10:08 am  Statement by Mr. Krubert.  
10:10 am  Court proceeds with making its record and sentencing the defendant.  Court will adopt joint recommendation for probation.  

SENTENCE:  
Withheld sentence on each count
Ct 2 - 3 years probation
Ct 3 - 1 year probation
2 days sentence credit if probation is revoked

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
1)  $500.00 fine plus court costs on EACH count.  
2)  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  
3)  Complete 50 hours of CSW during each year of probation in and for the benefit of Walworth County - without buyout.  
4)  AODA assessment and follow through with any recommended treatment.  
5)  Any other counseling as recommended by Agent.  
6)  No weapons.  
7)  No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  No prescription medication without a valid prescription and must be taken within limits of the prescription.  No driving without a valid license.  No contact with George Capriotti or Kurt Bullis.  
8)  Maintain full time employment or full time schooling or a combination of the two.  

Court gives warnings:
1)  May not vote until civil rights are restored.  
2)  May not possess firearms.  
10:16 am  Court in recess.
Sentencing hearing on January 5, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jonathan R Krubert in court with attorney Patrick Joseph Stangl.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Order on Pretrial Motions
In Court file

10:01 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Jonathan R Krubert in court with Atty Patrick Joseph Stangl.  
Matter is before the Court for hearing on the Deft's Motion to Suppress
Court was provided with the DVD and has had a chance to review it.
Court has a couple of questions before proceeding.  
10:02 am  Discussion between Court and Attys
Court viewed the DVD and thought it was clear that the Deft was nodding his head affirmatively.  
10:09 am  Deputy Cody Newmann is sworn & testifies on direct exam of Atty Necci.  
Exh 1 - DVD - recorded video interview with the Deft
Exh 1 - is offered and received.
10:14 am  Atty Necci plays portion of recorded interview.
10:18 am  Continued direct exam of Deputy Newmann by Atty Necci.  
10:22 am  Cross exam by Atty Stangl.  
10:26 am  Response by Deputy Newmann to Court's questions.  
10:27 am  Follow up questions of Deputy Newmann by Atty Necci.  
10:28 am  Witness excused.  10:28 am  Neither the State nor the Defense have any other evidence to present.
10:28 am  Court takes short recess.  
10:31 am  Court in session.  Court wanted to review "Lee" again.
10:33 am  Argument by Atty Necci.  10:35 am  Argument by Atty Stangl.  
10:36 am  Court proceeds with making its record.  Court finds Deputy Newmann's testimony to be credible and is supported by the review of the DVD and establishes the weight of the credible evidence.  Court denies the Motion to Suppress.  
Atty Stangl advises that he has other Motions on file.  Court will go through each of the Motions one-by-one.  
Motion to Compel Disclosure of C.I. - Atty Necci will turn over this information and allow review of any contractual agreement of the C.I. but once that happens negotiations with the State cease.  Motion granted and Atty Stangl can make decision about following through on this Motion if he so chooses.  
Motion with regard to independently testing drug samples.  Atty Necci indicates the results are in the DA's file and are available to Atty Stangl.  
Motion for Leave to file additional pre-trial Motions.  Motion dead line was extended for that purpose and there will be no further motions scheduled without leave of the Court.  
Motion with regard to Disclosure for Surveillance devices, etc.  Atty Necci advises that this will be disclosed and sent with the file to Atty Stangl.  Court grants motion.  
Motion with regard to other acts.  State has no other acts that it intends to use.  
Motion to preserve and produce rough notes of police officers.  No objection by DA Necci.  Motion granted.  
Motion to disclose photographs and other compilations.  Motion granted.  
Motion to preserve evidence.  Discussion between Court and Attys.  Motion granted.  
Motion for Discovery and Demand for Discovery and Inspection.  Atty Necci explains open file policy of their office.  Defense wants to independently test the drugs.  
Court asks Atty Stangl to submit Orders from today's Motions.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 2, 2016 at 2:30 pm before Judge DRETTWAN
Jury trial scheduled for November 7 and 8, 2016 at 8:30 am before Judge DRETTWAN
10:51 am  Court in recess.

**04/28/2016 - Transcript FILED;  Court Reporter:  Mark W. Garvin  (df)

Defendant Jonathan R Krubert in court with attorney Michael J. Fitzsimmons.  Atty Rea and Intern M. Fagan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes Filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH G.C.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
